cover_letter.intro_para: I am interested in the Software Engineering job at EMC Corporation. I became interested in the job, after searching the job position on NEU COOL. Although my major is information science, I took all the computer science classes in college and I meet the requirments of the computer knowledge for this job. I have enjoyed my past work at EMC in the position of ADS testing in Hopkinton, and I think I will fit well with EMC's culture and bring all the necessary abilities to go above and beyond my job requirements.

para_background.experience: I bring previous experience with Iron Python from my work at EMC in spring 2016 for my second co-op. As I mentioned before, I worked at Advanced Design Services group and I coded in Iron Python to test the newest servers and equipments. Our group, ADS, is a sub-team in DFx which stands for Design For X and my boss Dick Miller is the manager of the team. In this co-op, I haddeveloped a loop testing in Cumulus platform and it had been used by ADS to Qual Testware and will be used for Debug. I also earned a Bronze Award for this. In processing of developing the test sequence, I took the initiative to contact and work with the Cumulus Software Dev team in Shanghai to compelete it. Besides the developing of the loop sequence, I also developed the test for POST analyzer for Infinity/Arcus. In the last month of my co-op, my role was changed from a software developer to a SQA. I did the SQA job to release the tests for Infinity/Arcus by running tests on all the Warthogs and fixing the software or potential hardware problems with the team. I worked hard and communicated with dev groups from Shanghai, Cork and Franklin. Since all work is not done by one person, it's important to have the team work ability to accomplish the work. Besides the work, I attended the derating class and the IPMI class while I was working at EMC. I also attended the 3D printing workshop which was held in UMASS Lowell. I really enjoyed working at EMC because the EMC community has many events for employees from different cultures. There were Ping Pong competitions and lion dance during the Chinese New Year in February. These events help me put myself as a part of the EMC community.

I had my first co-op at Harvard School of Public Health in IT services, spring 2015. In this co-op, I developed strong customer service skills by troubleshooting usersâ€™ software and hardware problems. I communicated with customers by emails, phones and in-person. Because most of my customers are not experts in computer, I need to explain the reason of causing the problem and the way to prevent it. I also collaborated with team to manage helpdesk responsibilities and customer issues. These experience helped me gain communication skills by facing different people.
Aside from my work experience, I learned C++, Java, C, and XML from my courses at Northeastern University which is a perfect fit for this job as a software engineer.

closing_statements.compatability: Because of the previous work at EMC and my computer science knowledge, I think I will fit in well with the culture of EMC Corporation and this job position.
closing_statements.next_step: I hope you will call me at 857-222-0943 so that we can discuss the next step in the hiring process. I look forward to working for this company again. Thank you very much for your consideration!
